jswyll-vscode-rtthread.makeBaseDirectory: make's working root directory. It should be an absolute path, otherwise will not be able to locate the failed file.
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.generate.title: 生成
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.studioInstallPath: The folder of RT-Thread Studio Install. Select or manually enter the path, which may contain environment variables, such as ${'env:RTTHREAD_STUDIO_HOME} .
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.makeToolPath.mark: The folder of make tool. Select or manually enter the path, which may contain environment variables, such as `${env:MAKE_HOME}` .
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.compilerPath.mark: The GCC compiler file path, such as `D:/RT-ThreadStudio/repo/Extract/ToolChain_Support_Packages/ARM/GNU_Tools_for_ARM_Embedded_Processors/5.4.1/bin/arm-none-eabi-gcc` .
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.toolchainPath.mar: The GCC compiler folder path, such as `D:/RT-ThreadStudio/repo/Extract/ToolChain_Support_Packages/ARM/GNU_Tools_for_ARM_Embedded_Processors/5.4.1/bin` .
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.chipName.markdown: Chip name to download or debug the program, 11-character for STM32 (e.g. `STM32F407ZG` )
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.buildConfigName.m: Different configurations are available for different environments or targets, such as `Debug` and `Release` .
The default build task to execute when you press the key shortcut (`Ctrl+Shift+B`).
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.cmsisPack.markdow: File path of the Cmsis package corresponding to the chip. If the name of the chip is not [pyOCD Built-in targets] (https://pyocd.io/docs/builtin-targets.html) should be specified.
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.makefileProcessor: Listen for changes to the makefile and handle them.
jswyll-vscode-rtthread.autoDiagnosticInt: Whether to initiate diagnostics automatically. If enabled, The path meet `#jswyll-vscode-rtthread.diagnosticInterrupt.globPattern#` file appears RT-Thread fragment will automatically diagnosis if the interrupt function has been called `rt_interrupt_enter()` and `rt_interrupt_leave()`.
The relative path pattern [Glob expression](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) of file to be diagnosed.
